message: No but probably the iPad two.
@AndrewBrackin I think they're just going to put an i7 in it.
I'm curious what the specs of the iPad 2 will be.
oops, hopefully two cores if not faster
I have the first iPad, and what I'd like to see is higher pixel density and more memory.  That's kind of it though, other than that, I'm happy with mine.
@michaelschade i7 will kill the battery, it needs to keep over 6-8 hours to still be effective, right now people are getting 10, sometimes more.

@AndrewBrackin I know, just being playful :) Battery life is actually the main reason I have the iPad. I was at the Strange Loop conference with only 30% left on my battery and barely felt uneasy about that. With a laptop, I'd be scared to death and trying to conserve as much as possible for the rest of the day.

@ericflo Definitely on both points. I've also found the need for a back camera at times (wanting to be part of the cool Instagram or QR code-scanning people); "meh" about a front-facing one, though it might be neat.
@michaelschade lol, It could be possible to do an i7 in the future though, considering there's tablets with i5. Yeah, plus in a conference a tablet let's you demo things easily.

@AndrewBrackin That was one of the benefits, used it for notes during my talk. It's also nice to not have to carry around a big laptop (as much as I may love it) from building to building, or to have to block anyone else's view with it if you're in the audience (iPad is much less anti-social than the barrier that is the laptop screen).
I think it was in the new Dr. Dre & Eminem Song
I'm curious enough about developing apps for the HP TouchPad that I'll buy one if it's affordable enough and doesn't come with a contract.
well, depends on what you do.. in my case, medical services, iPad have good apps for physicians and students =) ..
